eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.bonuspack.location

Class GeocoderNominatim

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.bonuspack.location.GeocoderNominatim

  • public class GeocoderNominatim
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements an equivalent to Android Geocoder class, based on OpenStreetMap data and Nominatim API.
    See http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Nominatim or http://open.mapquestapi.com/nominatim/
    Author:
    M.Kergall

    • Method Detail

      • isPresent

        public static boolean isPresent()

      • setService

        public void setService(java.lang.String serviceUrl)
        Specify the url of the Nominatim service provider to use. Can be one of the predefined (NOMINATIM_SERVICE_URL or MAPQUEST_SERVICE_URL), or another one, your local instance of Nominatim for instance.

      • setOptions

        public void setOptions(boolean polygon)
        Parameters:
        polygon - true to get the polygon enclosing the location.

                                          double upperRightLatitude,
                                          double upperRightLongitude)

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        getFromLocationName(String locationName, int maxResults), about extra data added in Address results.

      • getFromLocationName

        public java.util.List<Address> getFromLocationName(java.lang.String locationName,
                                          int maxResults)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Equivalent to Geocoder::getFromLocation(String locationName, int maxResults).
        Some useful information, returned by Nominatim, that doesn't fit naturally within Android Address, are added in the bundle Address.getExtras():
        "boundingbox": the enclosing bounding box, as a BoundingBoxE6
        "osm_id": the OSM id, as a long
        "osm_type": one of the 3 OSM types, as a string (node, way, or relation).
        "polygonpoints": the enclosing polygon of the location (depending on setOptions usage), as an ArrayList of GeoPoint
        (others could be added if needed)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
